meanings.sent1: The tricky riddle can fuddle my mind.
meanings.sent2: The complex instructions may fuddle some people.
meanings.sent3: Trying to solve a puzzle when sleepy can really fuddle you.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected turn of events can fuddle even the most prepared.
meanings.sent5: The foggy weather can fuddle your sense of direction.

meanings.definition: A state of confusion or intoxication
meanings.sent1: After spinning around, I felt a fuddle in my head.
meanings.sent2: The loud noises added to the fuddle in his mind.
meanings.sent3: The mix-up at the party caused a funny fuddle among the guests.
meanings.sent4: The colorful lights created a fuddle of excitement in the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The strong drink led to a fuddle that made everything seem blurry.
